thread.title: Leonard Fournette still leads the nation in rushing yards
thread.title_full: Leonard Fournette still leads the nation in rushing yards | NOLA.com

author: Jim Kleinpeter, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: Leonard Fournette still leads the nation in rushing yards
text:
Leonard Fournette maintained his lead in individual rushing yardage among FBS schools after getting 180 yards and two touchdowns in LSU's 35-28 victory against Florida Saturday.
Fournette now has 1,202 yards, which is 205 yards better than Oregon's Royce Freeman at 997. Ezekiel Elliott of Ohio State is third with 988, followed by Wyoming's Brian Hill at 985 and Florida State's Dalvin Cook at 955.
Read more: Leonard Fournette Heisman Watch after Florida.
Fournette also held the lead in yards per game (200.3) and is tied for the lead in rushing touchdowns (14) with Houston quarterback Greg Ward Jr. Fournette, who ran the ball a career-high 31 times Saturday, is fifth in the nation in yards per carry at 8.01 on 150 carries. Matt Breida of Georgia Southern leads with a 10.29 average.
LSU is fourth in the nation in rushing yards per game with a 325.5 mark. Georgia Southern leads the way with 399 per game, followed by Baylor (348.7) and Navy (335.4).
